repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This is first draft of PR. Maybe it is worth of refactoring code of lookup modules to improve readability. Tests to be implemented.

Fixes #5511

comment_data.body: I think that this function deserves some refactoring. At least I find confusing `relative_to` parameter which has nothing with relative imports but contains just the `from` part of the import. I am not sure what could be the better name...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -178,7 +178,7 @@ def _check_pxd_filename(pos, pxd_pathname, qualified_name):
                     " Please use the normal Python package directory layout." % pxd_filename, level=1)
 
     def find_module(self, module_name, relative_to=None, pos=None, need_pxd=1,
-                    absolute_fallback=True):
+                    absolute_fallback=True, relative_import=False):

@@ -178,7 +178,7 @@ def _check_pxd_filename(pos, pxd_pathname, qualified_name):
                     " Please use the normal Python package directory layout." % pxd_filename, level=1)
 
     def find_module(self, module_name, relative_to=None, pos=None, need_pxd=1,
-                    absolute_fallback=True):
+                    absolute_fallback=True, relative_import=False):

comment_data.body: `os.path.join` might be clearer? Possibly moving the two names out into variables?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,69 @@
+PYTHON setup.py build_ext --inplace
+
+######## setup.py ########
+
+import os
+import sys
+from contextlib import contextmanager
+from Cython.Compiler.Errors import CompileError
+from Cython.Build.Dependencies import cythonize
+from distutils.core import setup
+if sys.version_info[0] < 3:
+    from StringIO import StringIO
+else:
+    from io import StringIO
+
+@contextmanager
+def assert_stderr(expected_error):
+    sys.path.append('other')
+    sys.stderr = temp_stderr = StringIO()
+    try:
+        yield
+    except CompileError:
+        assert expected_error in temp_stderr.getvalue(), '"%s" not found in stderr' % expected_error
+    else:
+        assert False, 'The module was imported even when it should not be importable'
+    finally:
+        temp_stderr.close()
+        sys.stderr = sys.__stderr__
+
+with assert_stderr('pkg' + os.sep + "aa.pyx:1:0: 'pkg" + os.sep + "bb.pxd' not found"):

comment_data.body: I wonder if it could at least be split in two - there seems to be a part that finds the module and a part that loads the pxd, and it maybe doesn't help to have them in one long function
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -178,7 +178,7 @@ def _check_pxd_filename(pos, pxd_pathname, qualified_name):
                     " Please use the normal Python package directory layout." % pxd_filename, level=1)
 
     def find_module(self, module_name, relative_to=None, pos=None, need_pxd=1,
-                    absolute_fallback=True):
+                    absolute_fallback=True, relative_import=False):

@@ -0,0 +1,69 @@
+PYTHON setup.py build_ext --inplace
+
+######## setup.py ########
+
+import os
+import sys
+from contextlib import contextmanager
+from Cython.Compiler.Errors import CompileError
+from Cython.Build.Dependencies import cythonize
+from distutils.core import setup
+if sys.version_info[0] < 3:
+    from StringIO import StringIO
+else:
+    from io import StringIO
+
+@contextmanager
+def assert_stderr(expected_error):
+    sys.path.append('other')
+    sys.stderr = temp_stderr = StringIO()
+    try:
+        yield
+    except CompileError:
+        assert expected_error in temp_stderr.getvalue(), '"%s" not found in stderr' % expected_error
+    else:
+        assert False, 'The module was imported even when it should not be importable'
+    finally:
+        temp_stderr.close()
+        sys.stderr = sys.__stderr__
+
+with assert_stderr('pkg' + os.sep + "aa.pyx:1:0: 'pkg" + os.sep + "bb.pxd' not found"):

comment_data.body: I found out that splitting `find_module()` into several separate functions is rather non-trivial. Hence, I am not going to do that in this PR to keep it light. But still I have renamed `relative_to` to better name.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -178,7 +178,7 @@ def _check_pxd_filename(pos, pxd_pathname, qualified_name):
                     " Please use the normal Python package directory layout." % pxd_filename, level=1)
 
     def find_module(self, module_name, relative_to=None, pos=None, need_pxd=1,
-                    absolute_fallback=True):
+                    absolute_fallback=True, relative_import=False):

commit.message: Add support of python 2.7 in the test.
Try to fix failing windows tests

Add more tests.

Co-authored-by: Matus Valo <matusvalo@gmail.com>

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

title: Fix leaking of Relative cimport out of the package to the environment
